text.section:
Work that an individual performs under any contract of hire is not covered employment if the Secretary is satisfied that:
the individual who performs the work is free from control and direction over its performance both in fact and under the contract;
the individual customarily is engaged in an independent business or occupation of the same nature as that involved in the work; and
the work is:
outside of the usual course of business of the person for whom the work is performed; or
performed outside of any place of business of the person for whom the work is performed.

The Secretary shall adopt regulations to provide:
general guidance about the application of subsection (a) of this section; and
specific examples of how subsection (a) of this section is applied to certain industries, including the construction industry, the landscaping industry, and the home care services industry.
